results.firPara: Arsène Wenger plans to offer Jack Wilshere a contract extension around the new year.
results.secPara: The midfielder, on a season-long loan at Bournemouth, will have one year remaining when he returns to Arsenal in the summer and Wenger wants to begin talks in January to retain the services of a homegrown player whose association with the club goes back to boyhood. Wenger quipped that negotiations would not be imminent – not before the Bournemouth game – but he did want to get cracking on talks soon. Ideally, yes.
results.webTitle: Arsenal plan to offer Jack Wilshere extended deal in new year

results.firPara: A heavy defeat at Chelsea followed by a frustrating home draw with Swansea City means Ronald Koeman could do with a win on his return to St Marys with Everton. His successor at Southampton, Claude Puel, will hope that his team overcome their profligate streak. They need to start scoring more, as bad finishing jeopardised their Europa League campaign in mid-week and has cost them a lot of points in the Premier League this season. Paul Doyle

Tottenham Hotspur will hardly be relishing their latest attempt to secure a first top-flight win at Stamford Bridge since 1990. Spurs are still coming to terms with their midweek defeat in Monaco which has cast them from the Champions League, with their unbeaten league record now under threat against the revitalised leaders. Antonio Contes side have been untouchable over recent weeks, a three-man defence yet to be breached after 590 minutes and the forward line back to its rampaging best. An awkward evening awaits the visitors. Dominic Fifield
• Former player alleges convicted paedophile George Ormond was his abuser
results.secPara: The escalating story of sexual abuse in football is now threatening to take in Newcastle United after a former player contacted the police to allege he was another victim on the back of growing concerns about a possible paedophile ring in the sport.
results.webTitle: Former Newcastle United player tells police he was abused in club’s youth system

results.firPara: The Liverpool midfielder reveals his disillusionment with the game last season, his debt of gratitude to Erwin Koeman, and formative hopes of being a gymnast
results.secPara: On 1 June Georginio Wijnaldum gave Holland a 2-1 win over Poland, driving his 13th goal of the season into the top corner of Wojciech Szczesnys net; he packed his bags in Gdansk and did not watch another competitive match until 10 July. It might have been longer had his friend not started the European Championship final that night. I was done with football for a few weeks, he explains, somewhat conservatively given he switched off for 39 days before switching on to Portugals mind-numbing victory over France. Failures with club and country had cut deep but they seem far away now. These are better days, he says with the broadest of grins. Far from done.
results.webTitle: Georginio Wijnaldum: ‘Klopp was interested in my personal life and that was good for me’

results.firPara: So, points shared, but youd warrant its the Brisbane fans who are much the happier for that. The Wanderers dominated possession and territory – dictating the tempo of the match, but they just couldnt fashion a dangerous final ball.
results.secPara: Over twenty crosses into the box, but with a centre-half duo as good as North and Devere you have to think Western Sydney needed to find a different dimension.
results.webTitle: Western Sydney Wanderers vs Brisbane Roar: A-League - as it happened

results.firPara: If the USMNT coach really wants to make an impact on US soccer a second time around, he must look at the problems inherent in the American game
results.secPara: Bruce Arena, the Brooklyn-born, no-nonsense manager who once elevated USA as high as fourth in the Fifa rankings, will return to a seat he once occupied for eight years. Between 1998 and 2006, the 65-year-old collected 71 wins for the US national team – including a memorable run to the 2002 World Cup quarter-finals – and became the most successful coach in the history of the national team. He has also proved himself on the domestic stage, winning five MLS Cups with LA Galaxy and DC United.
results.webTitle: Bruce Arena's biggest challenge as USA coach is reaching ignored communities

results.firPara: St Georges Park-based academy nurtures talented youngsters who have escaped attention of the top clubs and it is increasing its reach in youth football
results.secPara: St Georges Park-based academy nurtures talented youngsters who have escaped attention of the top clubs and it is increasing its reach in youth football
results.webTitle: Inside the Nike Academy: the branded alternative for reaching the big time

results.firPara: Unless the rest of his life is one enormous bluff, it is safe to assume Diego Costa is not a particularly successful poker player. It is never hard to know what he is thinking he is an open book whether he is scowling in anger, scowling in frustration, scowling in irritation or, as has increasingly been the case recently, scowling cheerily.
results.secPara: He doesnt just have a tremendously expressive face but also hugely expressive shoulders, and he seems to serve as a useful barometer of the teams mood, a brawny canary in the coal mine of the Chelsea dressing room.
results.webTitle: Diego Costa’s cheery scowl shows Chelsea are in a good place | Jonathan Wilson

results.firPara: Todays fluff has been blasting and laughing so long even my mama thinks that my mind is gone
results.secPara: Todays fluff has been blasting and laughing so long even my mama thinks that my mind is gone
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Willian to swap Chelsea for Manchester United?
